definition: to oppress the people/to act tyrannically
to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 霸[ba4]
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master
archaic variant of 汝[ru3]
female/woman/daughter
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to prey on the people
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
evil tyrant
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
to break into a house for robbery (idiom)
to kill and burn (idiom); murder and arson
to flout the law
tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
young thug/malicious young ruffian
bully/local ruffian
